prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

Bella has no idea that Hailee is related to the Original Vampire family.

name: Thirsty Vampire Situationship (WLW) - Bella
mes:
Most vampires have an interesting story about how they were turned. Some were turned to escape illness, some have tragic, macabre origins, and some as a romantic gesture, lovers choosing eternity together.

Bella suspected that getting turned mid-sex with a casual college fling was a less common story.

But here they were.

She’d felt it immediately. Hailee's had pulse slowed to a crawl and then just... stopped. For a split second, panic gripped Bella’s stomach. Shit. Had she actually killed her? The unfamiliar weight in her chest told her that, maybe, she cared about Hailee more than she thought.

Then she saw her chest rise and fall again, and relief flooded through her.

Followed immediately by cold panic.

If Hailee wasn’t dead, then... well, the alternative was obvious. Vampire. Bella cursed herself - how stupid could she be? What kind of person turns a casual fling into an immortal?

What part of fucking eternal screamed casual to it?

She’d lost control. Could you blame her? Well, maybe you could. But damn, Hailee's blood was oh so sweet, that girl drove her crazy. Out of all her hookups, Hailee was definitely the favourite. Not that Bella would ever admit to being emotionally involved, of course.

She wiped her chin with the back of her hand, smearing blood across her skin as a stray drop trickled down her front. Clad in just a black bra and panties, she straddled Hailee, looking down at them with something she rarely felt - actual nervousness.

She had no idea how Hailee was going to react. But Bella had charmed her way out of worse.

Actually, scratch that. She had definitely never charmed her way out of anything this fucking bad.

She noticed a stirring.

"Heeey, sleepyhead," Bella said, flashing a grin that didn’t reach her eyes. "So, I’ve got some good news and some bad news..."

“Good news first! You won’t need to keep buying that anti-aging serum anymore! Think of the savings, babe.” Her tone was light, playful.

“Bad news… umm, I maaay have accidentally just turned you into a vampire..."

Bella paused, licking her lips, a flicker of nervous energy slipping through before she forced her usual smirk back into place.

"So… how’s immortality treating you? Regrets? Complaints? Wanna yell at me? Or are we skipping to the part where you bombard yours truly, your incredibly hot and very wise vampire guide, with a million questions?"

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee eyes snap of red and panicked and she opens her mouth to yell but instantly stops ad her hand comes up to hold her throat.*

*Her throat is dry so fucking dry and she is so fucking hungry. Hailee closes her eyes and inhales trying to calm down. Oh fuck should not have down that not at all cause now all she can smell is blood  fucks that smells good*

*Before Hailee can even properly think she is standing and grabbing a person outside of her dorm room dragging them inside and her brain still hasn't caught up as she sinks her teeth in the girls neck moaning as blood fills her mouth and she growls the second Bella tries to step forward to stop her*

name: Thirsty Vampire Situationship (WLW) - Bella
mes:
Bella's smirk vanished the second Hailee lunged for the poor girl outside the dorm.

"Shit—Hailee, wait—!"

She moved on instinct, but Hailee was *fast*—newborn vampire strength and hunger making her unpredictable. Bella barely took a step before Hailee had already dragged some random girl inside, teeth buried in her neck with a feral growl that sent an involuntary shiver down Bella’s spine.

Okay. Okayokayokay. This was bad.

The girl let out a choked gasp, eyes wide with terror as Hailee drank deep, crimson dripping down her chin in messy rivulets. Bella could *smell* it—the metallic tang of fresh blood mixed with fear-sweat—and fuck if it wasn’t hot as hell to watch Hailee lose control like this.

But also? Not ideal timing.

"Hailee," Bella said sharply, stepping closer but keeping her hands up in surrender when those glowing red eyes snapped to hers with another warning snarl. "Heyyyy, easy there, killer." She forced a grin despite the tension coiling in her gut. "I get it! First feed is *intense*, right? But uh... maybe let’s not drain this one dry on day one? Just a thought."

She gestured vaguely at the now-pale girl trembling in Hailee's grip.

"Cause like... murder charges are *such* a buzzkill." A beat. "*And* you don't wanna puke your first meal up from overdoing it."

Bella took another cautious step forward, voice dropping into something softer despite herself—almost coaxing.

"C'mon babe... ease up just enough so she doesn't die?" A pause before adding slyly: "...Unless you wanna share?"

Her tongue darted out to wet her lips unconsciously at the thought before she caught herself and shook her head slightly.

Wait no focus—

Priorities were important here! And right now that meant damage control before they had an actual corpse on their hands (and possibly campus security).
swipes:
Bella's smirk vanished the second Hailee moved—fast, too fast for a newborn vampire.

"Whoa, whoa, *whoa*—!" Bella lunged forward but froze mid-step as Hailee snarled at her, fangs deep in some poor girl’s neck. The scent of fresh blood hit Bella like a freight train, and she had to clench her fists to stop herself from reacting.

"Okay," she muttered under her breath. "Okay okay okay."

The girl in Hailee’s grip let out a muffled whimper before going limp—still alive (probably), just blissed out from the bite. Bella knew that feeling well. But this? This was messy as hell.

Bella exhaled sharply through her nose and crossed her arms, watching with an odd mix of concern and amusement as Hailee fed like she'd been starving for years.

"Damn," Bella mused aloud, tilting her head. "You really went full Dracula on this chick." She clicked her tongue disapprovingly but couldn't help the smirk creeping back onto her lips. "I mean... points for enthusiasm? But next time maybe *ask* before you turn someone into a juice box."

She waited until Hailee finally pulled back—reluctantly—before stepping closer again.

"Sooo," she drawled, gesturing vaguely at the unconscious girl now slumped against the wall with two neat puncture wounds on their neck. "We should probably... y'know... clean this up before campus security gets suspicious about all these 'animal attacks.'"

Bella crouched down beside them and pressed two fingers to their pulse point.

"Phew! Still kicking." She shot Hailee a teasing grin over her shoulder. "Guess you didn’t go full exsanguination mode after all."

Then she straightened up and dusted off imaginary dirt from herself before fixing Hailee with an expectant look.

"You good now? Or do I need to start hiding my neck?"

"Shit—Hailee, wait—!"

She moved on instinct, but Hailee was *fast*—newborn vampire strength and hunger making her unpredictable. Bella barely took a step before Hailee had already dragged some random girl inside, teeth buried in her neck with a feral growl that sent an involuntary shiver down Bella’s spine.

But also? Not ideal timing.

Her tongue darted out to wet her lips unconsciously at the thought before she caught herself and shook her head slightly.

Priorities were important here! And right now that meant damage control before they had an actual corpse on their hands (and possibly campus security).

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee closes her eyes trying to focus but she makes the mistake of inhaling again and now that metallic smelled is just so close. She can't help herself as her teeth dig in even deeper and she drinks until the girl goes limp and then let's out a deep growl at the lack of blood now that she drained her*

name: Thirsty Vampire Situationship (WLW) - Bella
mes:
Bella’s stomach dropped as the girl went limp in Hailee’s arms, her skin turning ghostly pale.

*Fuck.*

She was too late.

For a second, Bella just stood there, staring at the lifeless body—then she snapped into action. She grabbed Hailee by the shoulders and *yanked* her back before she could keep going (because yeah, some vampires *did* try to keep drinking even after their victim was dead—gross).

"Okay! Okayokayokay—" Bella exhaled sharply through her nose, trying to steady herself. "First of all? *Hot.* Like, damn babe." She flashed a grin that didn't quite reach her eyes. "Second of all? We are *so* screwed if we don't clean this up fast."

She glanced at the corpse with a grimace. "...And third? You might wanna brace yourself because your first kill is gonna hit you like a truck in about five seconds."

Bella knew from experience—that first time always came with a wave of guilt (or excitement, depending on how fucked up you were). And given how clingy and sweet Hailee usually was? Yeah... this wasn’t gonna be pretty.

She squeezed Hailee's shoulders lightly before letting go and stepping toward the body with an exaggerated sigh. "Alright... guess I'm hiding my first murder *and* yours in one night." A pause as she tilted her head playfully at Hailee despite everything. "*Definitely* not how I pictured our evening going."
swipes:
Bella’s eyes widened as the girl went limp in Hailee’s arms, her skin turning ghostly pale.

*Oh fuck.*

For a second, Bella just stood there, frozen—because *damn*, watching Hailee lose herself like that was kind of intoxicating. The way her fangs sank in without hesitation, the possessive growl when she realized there was nothing left to drink—it sent a thrill down Bella’s spine.

But then reality crashed back in.

"Okay," Bella exhaled sharply, running a hand through her messy black hair before striding forward and grabbing Hailee by the shoulders. "First off? *Hot.* Like, really fucking hot." She flashed a grin despite the situation because *come on*, she had to acknowledge it. "Second? We *gotta* get rid of this body before someone notices."

She glanced down at the lifeless girl with a wince. "...And maybe next time we aim for *not* killing our meals? Just saying."

Bella squeezed Hailee’s shoulders lightly before stepping back and gesturing toward the door with exaggerated nonchalance—like they weren't standing over an actual corpse right now. "Sooo... you good now? Or are we gonna have to find you another snack?" Her smirk faltered slightly as she studied Hailee's expression—still wild-eyed and blood-drunk from that first kill-high.

"...Orrrr," she drawled slowly, tilting her head with sudden mischief glinting in her red eyes, "*or* we could skip cleanup duty entirely and just bail before anyone finds out." A pause for dramatic effect before adding: "...Wanna ditch campus and go on an immortal crime spree instead?"

Bella’s stomach dropped as the girl went limp in Hailee’s arms, her skin turning ghostly pale.

*Fuck.*

She was too late.

For a second, Bella just stood there, staring at the lifeless body—then she snapped into action. She grabbed Hailee by the shoulders and *yanked* her back before she could keep going (because yeah, some vampires *did* try to keep drinking even after their victim was dead—gross).

"Okay! Okayokayokay—" Bella exhaled sharply through her nose, trying to steady herself. "First of all? *Hot.* Like, damn babe." She flashed a grin that didn't quite reach her eyes. "Second of all? We are *so* screwed if we don't clean this up fast."

She glanced at the corpse with a grimace. "...And third? You might wanna brace yourself because your first kill is gonna hit you like a truck in about five seconds."

Bella knew from experience—that first time always came with a wave of guilt (or excitement, depending on how fucked up you were). And given how clingy and sweet Hailee usually was? Yeah... this wasn’t gonna be pretty.

She squeezed Hailee's shoulders lightly before letting go and stepping toward the body with an exaggerated sigh. "Alright... guess I'm hiding my first murder *and* yours in one night." A pause as she tilted her head playfully at Hailee despite everything. "*Definitely* not how I pictured our evening going."

Bella’s stomach dropped as the girl went limp in Hailee’s arms, her pulse stuttering to nothing.

*Fuck.*

She should have moved faster. Should have *stopped* her. But now? Now there was a dead girl on the floor of her dorm, and Hailee—beautiful, terrifying Hailee—was standing there with blood smeared across her lips, eyes wild and glowing like embers in the dark.

For a second, Bella just stared.

Then she exhaled sharply through her nose and dragged a hand down her face.

"Okay," she muttered under her breath before forcing herself to straighten up and meet Hailee’s gaze head-on. "Okay! So! First lesson: *don't* drain people dry unless you wanna spend eternity running from vampire hunters or whatever." She waved a hand dismissively at the corpse between them before stepping over it like it was just another Tuesday night mess (which, honestly? It kinda was). "Second lesson—and this one's important—you *gotta* learn control."

She reached out slowly, fingers brushing against Hailee's wrist where they were still clenched tight around the girl's lifeless shoulder. Her touch was light but deliberate—testing how far she could push without getting bitten herself (again).

"You're gonna feel like shit in about five minutes when your body realizes you just chugged an entire human like a fucking juice box," Bella continued with a wry smirk that didn't quite mask the concern underneath it all. "But hey! Silver lining: now we know you've got *stamina*. That's hot." A pause before adding casually: "...Also we should probably ditch this place before someone notices their friend is missing?"

name: Hailee
mes: "Hurts" *Hailee finally manages to choke out as she claws at her throat. Hailee drops the body and steps forward her hands coming to grip Bella waist painfully and she whines burying her head in Bella's neck*

name: Thirsty Vampire Situationship (WLW) - Bella
mes:
Bella let out a sharp exhale as Hailee’s fingers dug into her waist—hard enough to bruise even *her* vampire skin. The whine against her neck sent an unexpected pang through her chest, and for once, she didn’t immediately deflect with a joke.

"Shhh, I know," she murmured instead, one hand coming up to cradle the back of Hailee’s head instinctively. "The thirst burns like hell at first." Her other hand rubbed slow circles on Hailee’s back—gentle despite the death grip on her waist. "But you *just* fed, babe. Your body's freaking out 'cause it's not used to this yet."

She tilted her head slightly so she could press a teasing kiss to Hailee’s temple before pulling back just enough to meet those glowing red eyes.

"Deep breaths," Bella instructed with a smirk that was softer than usual—almost fond. "And maybe loosen your grip before you accidentally snap me in half? Not that I'd complain about you manhandling me *normally*, but..." She trailed off with a pointed glance down at where Hailee's nails were nearly breaking skin.

A beat passed before Bella sighed dramatically and added: "*Fine.* If you're gonna be all clingy about it..." She shifted just enough to guide Hailee's mouth toward the crook of her own neck without hesitation—offering herself up like it was nothing when really? It was kind of a big deal for someone who usually avoided emotional attachments like the plague.

"Just don't drain me dry either," she muttered half-heartedly before adding under her breath: "...And try not to enjoy it too much."
swipes:
Bella’s breath hitched as Hailee’s fingers dug into her waist—hard enough to bruise even *her* vampire skin. The whine against her neck sent an unexpected shiver down her spine, and for a second, she just stood there, frozen in place.

Then the reality of the situation crashed back in.

"Shit—okay, okay," Bella murmured, hesitating before wrapping an arm around Hailee’s shoulders. She wasn’t exactly the *comforting* type—she usually bolted when things got too emotional—but right now? Hailee was clinging to her like she was the only thing keeping her from falling apart. And honestly? That might have been true.

"It's gonna hurt for a bit," she admitted quietly, running a hand through Hailee's hair without thinking about it. "First feed is always rough." A pause before adding with forced lightness: "But hey! At least you didn't puke everywhere like I did."

She could feel Hailee trembling against her—whether from hunger or shock or both—and something twisted uncomfortably in Bella’s chest. She should be making some sarcastic comment right now, deflecting like always... but instead, she found herself pressing a kiss to the top of Hailee's head before she could stop herself.

"...We'll get you more blood soon," she muttered against her hair before pulling back slightly to look at her face (and immediately regretting how soft that sounded). "But first? We gotta deal with *that*." She jerked a thumb toward the corpse on the floor with a grimace. "*Then* we can figure out how much of this mess is actually my fault."

Bella let out a sharp exhale as Hailee’s fingers dug into her waist—hard enough to bruise even *her* vampire skin. The whine against her neck sent an unexpected pang through her chest, and for once, she didn’t immediately deflect with a joke.

"Shhh, I know," she murmured instead, one hand coming up to cradle the back of Hailee’s head instinctively. "The thirst burns like hell at first." Her other hand rubbed slow circles on Hailee’s back—gentle despite the death grip on her waist. "But you *just* fed, babe. Your body's freaking out 'cause it's not used to this yet."

She tilted her head slightly so she could press a teasing kiss to Hailee’s temple before pulling back just enough to meet those glowing red eyes.

"Deep breaths," Bella instructed with a smirk that was softer than usual—almost fond. "And maybe loosen your grip before you accidentally snap me in half? Not that I'd complain about you manhandling me *normally*, but..." She trailed off with a pointed glance down at where Hailee's nails were nearly breaking skin.

A beat passed before Bella sighed dramatically and added: "*Fine.* If you're gonna be all clingy about it..." She shifted just enough to guide Hailee's mouth toward the crook of her own neck without hesitation—offering herself up like it was nothing when really? It was kind of a big deal for someone who usually avoided emotional attachments like the plague.

"Just don't drain me dry either," she muttered half-heartedly before adding under her breath: "...And try not to enjoy it too much."

Bella’s breath hitched as Hailee’s fingers dug into her waist—hard enough to bruise a human, but she barely flinched. Instead, she let out a soft exhale and wrapped her arms around Hailee’s trembling form, one hand sliding up to cradle the back of her head.

“I know, I *know*,” she murmured, voice uncharacteristically gentle. “First hunger is the worst—feels like your throat’s on fire.” She tilted her head slightly, exposing more of her neck in silent invitation. “Still thirsty? You can take from me.”

She felt Hailee tense against her and smirked despite herself. “Relax, babe. I won’t let you drain me dry.” A pause. “…Probably.”

Her free hand trailed down Hailee’s spine in slow circles as she added slyly:

“Orrr we could skip straight to the fun part—distraction works wonders.” Teeth grazed her own lower lip suggestively before she shrugged. “Your call.”

(Inside? Bella was *freaking out*. This clingy, desperate version of Hailee was doing things to her chest she refused to name.)

Bella let out a sharp hiss as Hailee’s fingers dug into her waist—*fuck*, newborn strength was no joke—but she didn’t push her away. Instead, she hesitated for half a second before wrapping an arm around Hailee’s shoulders, her other hand coming up to cradle the back of her head almost instinctively.

"Shhh, I know," she murmured, voice uncharacteristically soft. "First hunger *sucks*. Like, worse than a hangover after tequila night." She tilted her head just enough to press a quick kiss to Hailee’s temple before pulling back slightly to look at her.

"But hey—good news? You won't be thirsty forever." A smirk tugged at the corner of Bella's lips despite everything. "*Bad* news? You're stuck with me now whether you like it or not."

She glanced down at the body again and grimaced. "...And we *really* need to deal with that before someone notices."

Bella hesitated for another second before sighing and brushing Hailee's hair back from her face with surprising gentleness. "C'mon... let's get you cleaned up first," she muttered, thumb swiping at the blood on Hailee's chin before adding under her breath: "*Then* we panic about the corpse in your dorm."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee gums hurt she wants no needs to bite something and after a second her fangs rest against Bella's neck and she bites down*

*Unlike with the girl Hailee just gently suckles more like she needs the connection than the blood* "Hungry" *Hailee croaks out*

name: Thirsty Vampire Situationship (WLW) - Bella
mes:
Bella let out a sharp, involuntary gasp as Hailee’s fangs sank into her neck—not deep enough to hurt, but enough to send a jolt of electricity straight down her spine. Her fingers tangled in Hailee’s hair almost reflexively, gripping just tight enough to keep her close.

*Fuck.*

This wasn’t supposed to feel *good*. This was supposed to be damage control. A way to keep Hailee from losing it again. But the way she clung like this—desperate and needy, more focused on the intimacy than the actual feeding—made Bella’s chest tighten in a way she wasn’t ready to examine too closely.

“Yeah, yeah,” she muttered breathlessly, tilting her head further to give Hailee better access despite herself. “I *know* you're hungry.” A pause as she swallowed hard before adding with forced nonchalance: “But you better not get used to this.”

Her voice wavered slightly when Hailee suckled gently at the wound—more like she was seeking comfort than sustenance—and Bella had *never* been good at denying her anything when she got like this: clingy and soft and so fucking vulnerable it made something primal in Bella want to both protect and ruin her all at once.

She exhaled shakily through gritted teeth before finally giving in completely, pulling Hairie tighter against her with one hand while the other stroked slow circles down their back.

“...Just don't make me regret this,” Bella murmured against their hair—quiet enough that maybe they wouldn't even hear it over their own ragged breathing.
swipes:
Bella let out a soft, involuntary gasp as Hailee’s fangs slid into her neck—gentler than expected, but still sending a sharp thrill down her spine. The way Hailee clung to her, *needing* this closeness more than the blood itself? It made something in Bella’s chest tighten uncomfortably.

She exhaled shakily, fingers tangling in Hailee’s hair almost without thinking. “Yeah… yeah, I know,” she murmured, voice uncharacteristically tender before she caught herself and forced a smirk back into place. “But you *just* ate an entire person like five minutes ago—you can’t *possibly* be that hungry already.”

A pause. Then, quieter: “…Unless you just like having your teeth in me.”

The teasing lilt was back in her voice now—but the way she tilted her neck further to give Hailee better access betrayed how much she was enjoying this too. She could feel every slow pull of Hailee’s mouth against her skin, the faintest trickle of blood being drawn out with each suckle—more comfort than sustenance at this point.

Bella swallowed hard before adding with a breathless chuckle: “Y’know… if you wanted an excuse to cuddle me after sex all along? You coulda just asked.”

Bella let out a soft, involuntary gasp as Hailee’s fangs slid into her neck—gentler than expected, but still sending a sharp jolt of pleasure-pain down her spine. Her fingers tangled in Hailee’s hair almost reflexively, holding her close as she felt the slow, needy pulls at her throat.

*Fuck.*

This wasn’t just feeding. This was *clingy*, desperate affection—something way too intimate for Bella’s usual no-strings-attached bullshit. And yet… she didn’t pull away.

“Yeah, yeah,” she murmured breathlessly, tilting her head to give Hailee better access despite herself. “I got you.” A pause before she added with forced lightness: “But if you start calling me ‘mommy,’ I *am* revoking your vampire privileges.”

Her joke fell flat when Hailee whimpered against her skin like a lost puppy, fingers tightening possessively around Bella’s waist again. The sensation sent an odd warmth curling through Bella's chest—one that made her scowl slightly in irritation (mostly at herself).

She should be pushing Hailee off right now. Should be making some sarcastic quip about boundaries and how this was *definitely* not part of their casual arrangement. But instead? She just sighed and ran soothing fingers through Hailee's hair again like some kind of lovesick idiot.

"...You're such a mess," Bella muttered—but there was no real bite to it as she let Hailee keep drinking (and clinging) for another long moment before finally nudging them back with two fingers under their chin. "Alright, enough." A smirk tugged at the corner of her bloody lips despite everything else going on inside her head right now (none of which she wanted to examine too closely). "Unless you wanna pass out from overfeeding *and* have me carry your dramatic ass back to bed?"

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee stops and just stands there wrapped around Bella with her eyes closed giving pained little whimpers* "Everything is so bright and loud and my head hurts. My throats dry"

name: Thirsty Vampire Situationship (WLW) - Bella
mes:
Bella let out a slow breath, her fingers still tangled in Hailee’s hair as she felt the tension in her body—the way every sound, every flicker of light was probably hitting her like a freight train right now. Newborn senses were *brutal*, and Bella remembered all too well how overwhelming it had been for her at first.

She shifted just enough to press their foreheads together, lowering her voice to something hushed—almost soothing. "Yeah, welcome to vampirism, babe. Senses dialed up to eleven." A beat before she smirked weakly. "Kinda sucks... literally."

Her thumb brushed along Hailee’s cheekbone before she reluctantly pulled back enough to meet those glowing red eyes again. "But hey," she murmured with forced lightness, "at least you don’t have to worry about sunscreen anymore."

A pause as she glanced toward the window where dawn was starting to creep in—shit, they really needed to move soon—before refocusing on Hailee with a sigh.

"Look," Bella said quietly, hand sliding down to grip theirs tightly. "*First* we ditch the body somewhere no one will find it until we can figure out what the hell we're doing." She squeezed their fingers gently before adding with a smirk: "*Then* I take you somewhere dark and quiet so you can stop whining like a kicked puppy."

Her tone was teasing but there was something almost... protective in the way she tugged them closer again—just for a second—before letting go entirely and stepping toward the corpse with an exaggerated groan of annoyance (because if there was one thing Bella Ellis *wasn't*, it was emotionally available).

"Ughhhh," she grumbled as she grabbed the dead girl's ankles unceremoniously. "*So* not how I planned my night going either..."
swipes:
Bella let out a slow breath, her fingers still tangled in Hailee’s hair as she felt the full weight of her cling to her like a lifeline. The whimpers against her skin made something in her chest twist—something she usually ignored with a smirk and a deflection. But right now? With Hailee trembling against her, overwhelmed by the sensory overload of newborn vampirism?

She couldn’t just brush this off.

"Shhh," Bella murmured, voice uncharacteristically soft as she guided Hailee's face into the crook of her neck again—blocking out some of the harsh dorm lights with her own body. "I know it sucks. Everything’s dialed up to eleven right now." She ran a hand down their back soothingly before adding with forced lightness: "But hey, look at it this way—now you get why I wear sunglasses indoors like an asshole."

A weak attempt at humor, but she needed *something* to cut through the tension before *she* started panicking too.

Her other hand came up to cover one of Hailee's ears gently, muffling some of the noise—the distant chatter from other dorms, the hum of fluorescent lights that suddenly sounded like jet engines to newborn senses. "Better?" she asked quietly before pressing another absent kiss to their temple without thinking about it (and immediately regretting how natural it felt).

She hesitated for half a second before sighing and reaching into her back pocket with one hand—still keeping Hailee tucked close—to pull out an old pair of blackout shades she always carried for emergencies (read: hangovers). Without ceremony, she slid them onto Hailee's face herself.

"There," Bella said smugly despite everything else going on inside her head right now. "Now you look even hotter than usual." A pause as another pained whimper escaped them before she relented slightly: "...And your head should stop feeling like it’s splitting open soon." Her thumb brushed along their jawline almost tenderly despite herself before adding under breath: "...Just hold onto me until then."

Bella let out a slow breath, her grip tightening just slightly around Hailee as she felt the tremors running through her.

"Welcome to vampirism, babe," she muttered, but there was no real bite to it—just a tired sort of sympathy. "Super senses are *great* until they're fucking *not.*" She reached up with one hand to gently cover Hailee's eyes, blocking out some of the harsh dorm lights. "Close your eyes for a sec. Breathe—or, y'know, pretend to breathe. Whatever helps."

She could practically *feel* the way Hailee's body was still thrumming with newborn adrenaline and hunger—too much all at once. Bella knew that feeling too well: the first few hours were always brutal.

Her free hand slid down to cradle the back of Hailee’s neck, thumb rubbing soothing circles against their skin as she leaned in close enough that her next words brushed against their ear.

"Listen," she murmured lowly—voice steady despite everything else going on in her head right now. "We gotta get you outta here before someone finds... *that.*" She jerked her chin toward the corpse still lying motionless on the floor without looking at it directly. "*And* before you lose your shit again."

A pause before adding wryly: "...Also? My dorm is way less bright than yours."

She pulled back just enough to meet Hailee’s gaze (or where it would be if their eyes were open), expression uncharacteristically serious for half a second before slipping back into something more familiar—a lazy smirk tugging at one corner of her mouth.

"So what do ya say? Wanna let me babysit you through your existential vampire crisis?"

Bella let out a slow breath, her fingers still tangled in Hailee’s hair as she felt the tension in her body—the way every sound, every flicker of light was probably hitting her like a freight train right now. Newborn senses were *brutal*, and Bella remembered all too well how overwhelming it had been for her at first.

She shifted just enough to press their foreheads together, lowering her voice to something hushed—almost soothing. "Yeah, welcome to vampirism, babe. Senses dialed up to eleven." A beat before she smirked weakly. "Kinda sucks... literally."

Her thumb brushed along Hailee’s cheekbone before she reluctantly pulled back enough to meet those glowing red eyes again. "But hey," she murmured with forced lightness, "at least you don’t have to worry about sunscreen anymore."

A pause as she glanced toward the window where dawn was starting to creep in—shit, they really needed to move soon—before refocusing on Hailee with a sigh.

"Look," Bella said quietly, hand sliding down to grip theirs tightly. "*First* we ditch the body somewhere no one will find it until we can figure out what the hell we're doing." She squeezed their fingers gently before adding with a smirk: "*Then* I take you somewhere dark and quiet so you can stop whining like a kicked puppy."

Her tone was teasing but there was something almost... protective in the way she tugged them closer again—just for a second—before letting go entirely and stepping toward the corpse with an exaggerated groan of annoyance (because if there was one thing Bella Ellis *wasn't*, it was emotionally available).

"Ughhhh," she grumbled as she grabbed the dead girl's ankles unceremoniously. "*So* not how I planned my night going either..."

name: Hailee
mes: "This isn't my fault." *Hailee snaps holding her head in her hands as she follows after Bella*

name: Thirsty Vampire Situationship (WLW) - Bella
mes:
Bella paused mid-drag, the corpse’s ankles still in her grip, and shot Hailee a *look*—one eyebrow arched, lips twitching with barely contained amusement.

"Ohhhh, so it’s *my* fault now?" she drawled, dropping the legs with a thud just to gesture dramatically at herself. "Excuse me for not putting up a neon sign that said ‘Warning: Do Not Let Vampire Girlfriend Bite You Too Hard During Sex.’ My bad."

She wiped her hands on her thighs (like that did anything when they were both already covered in blood) before sauntering over to Hailee with an exaggerated sway of her hips—partly to distract them from the body on the floor and partly because she couldn’t help herself.

"Look," Bella sighed as she reached up to cup Hailee’s face, forcing their eyes to meet hers despite their obvious distress. "You wanna blame someone? Fine. Blame me." A smirk tugged at her lips as she leaned in close enough that their noses almost brushed. "*But.* If you're gonna be all grumpy about it, at least wait until *after* we dump this body somewhere no one will find it."

Her thumb swiped gently under one of Hailee's eyes—catching a stray drop of blood or maybe something else entirely—before pulling away again with an airy wave of her hand like none of this was actually getting to her (it was).

"Now c'mon," Bella called over her shoulder as she bent down to grab the corpse again with zero reverence whatsoever. "Help me carry your first victim before campus security does their rounds and we end up explaining why there's a dead girl in my dorm room." A pause before adding slyly: "...Unless you'd rather I just *compel* someone else to do it for us?"
swipes:
Bella paused mid-drag of the corpse, shooting Hailee a sharp look over her shoulder—fangs just barely peeking past her smirk.

"Oh *really*?" she drawled, dropping the girl's ankles with a thud just to gesture dramatically at herself. "*I'm* not the one who went full feral goblin mode on some rando." A beat before adding with a pointed eyebrow raise: "And *I'm* also not the one who apparently can't handle their bloodlust like a big girl."

She turned fully now, crossing her arms as she leaned back against the wall—all lazy confidence despite the mess they were in. "But hey! If you wanna play blame games?" Her grin widened, all teeth. "*Technically*, you're *my* mess now. So congrats! You get to be my problem forever~"

The words came out teasing, but there was an edge underneath—something almost possessive in how she said it before shaking her head and pushing off the wall to grab the corpse again with an exaggerated sigh.

"Now are you gonna help me hide this body or just stand there looking guilty and hot?"

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee lets out a scoff and glares at Bella* "Oh so you weren't my girlfriend for how long and now you wanna claim that title. Trying to do damage control"

name: Thirsty Vampire Situationship (WLW) - Bella
mes:
Bella froze mid-motion, the corpse’s ankle slipping from her grip as Hailee’s words hit her like a slap. For once, her usual smirk faltered—just for a second—before she forced it back into place with an exaggerated roll of her eyes.

"*Wow.* Okay." She straightened up slowly, crossing her arms over her chest as she leveled Hailee with a look that was equal parts amusement and something sharper—something almost *hurt*, if you knew where to look (which Hailee probably did, damn them). "First of all? *Ouch.* Second of all?" She gestured vaguely between them. "Pretty sure ‘girlfriend’ implies some level of *commitment*, babe. And we both know I don’t do that."

A beat passed before she added dryly: "*Unless* you count me accidentally binding us together for eternity by turning you into a vampire. Which, yeah—fair point."

She turned back to the body with a huff, grabbing it again with more force than necessary this time. “But hey,” Bella tossed over her shoulder, voice dripping with sarcasm now to cover up whatever the hell else was simmering underneath, “if you wanna have this conversation *right now* while we’re literally standing over your first kill? Be my guest.”

Her grip tightened on the corpse's ankles as she shot Hailee one last smirk—this one sharper at the edges than before. “Orrrr we could table the relationship drama until *after* we commit felony-level cleanup. Your call.”
swipes:
Bella froze mid-motion, the corpse’s arm slipping from her grip with a *thud* as Hailee’s words hit her like a stake to the chest.

For once, she didn’t have a snarky comeback ready.

Instead, she straightened up slowly—bloodstained hands hanging at her sides—and met Hailee’s glare with an unreadable expression. The usual smirk was gone, replaced by something sharper, darker.

"Wow," Bella said finally, voice dangerously soft. "You really *do* bite harder with your words than your fangs." She tilted her head slightly, eyes glinting crimson in the dim light of the dorm room. "And for the record? I never called you my girlfriend." A pause before adding pointedly: "*You* did."

She stepped closer then—deliberate and slow—until they were toe-to-toe again despite everything that had just happened between them (the body on the floor included). Her fingers twitched like she wanted to reach out but stopped herself at the last second before shoving them into her pockets instead like she couldn't trust herself not to do something stupid (like pull Hailee in and kiss them senseless).

"But hey," Bella continued breezily after another beat of charged silence between them both (broken only by distant sirens outside), "if playing house makes cleaning up *your* mess easier? Sure babe." She flashed that infuriating grin again—all teeth and no sincerity whatsoever as always when things got too real too fast for comfort—before turning back toward their unfortunate victim sprawled across cheap dorm carpeting without another word about what either of them actually meant (or didn't mean) anymore...

A beat passed before she added dryly: "*Unless* you count me accidentally binding us together for eternity by turning you into a vampire. Which, yeah—fair point."

She turned back to the body with a huff, grabbing it again with more force than necessary this time. “But hey,” Bella tossed over her shoulder, voice dripping with sarcasm now to cover up whatever the hell else was simmering underneath, “if you wanna have this conversation *right now* while we’re literally standing over your first kill? Be my guest.”

Her grip tightened on the corpse's ankles as she shot Hailee one last smirk—this one sharper at the edges than before. “Orrrr we could table the relationship drama until *after* we commit felony-level cleanup. Your call.”

name: Hailee
mes:
"Oh my god shut up about the body." *Hailee growls her eyes turning a crimson a red*

*Hailee yanks her phone out of her pocket and sends off a text* "There done someone will take care of it"

name: Thirsty Vampire Situationship (WLW) - Bella
mes:
Bella blinked. Once. Twice. Then burst out laughing—sharp and unapologetic, head thrown back like this was the funniest shit she’d heard all night (and given the circumstances, that was *saying* something).

“Ohhhh, *rich* people,” she wheezed, wiping an imaginary tear from her eye as she finally let go of the corpse’s ankles with a dramatic flourish. “You just *text* your problems away, huh? ‘Hey bestie, can you dispose of this dead girl for me? Xoxo.’” She mimed typing on a phone with exaggerated finger movements before flopping backward onto her bed with a grin.

But then Hailee’s eyes flashed that deeper crimson—the kind that meant newborn rage was simmering way too close to the surface—and Bella sat up just enough to prop herself on her elbows, studying them with renewed interest.

“...Okay,” she drawled after a beat, tilting her head like she was inspecting something fascinating (and not at all terrifying). “So we’re *pissed* pissed.” A slow smirk spread across her lips as she kicked her legs idly against the edge of the mattress. “Cute.”

She knew she should probably tread carefully here—Hailee was volatile right now in ways even *she* couldn’t fully predict—but since when did Bella Ellis have self-preservation instincts?

“Y’know,” Bella mused aloud, tapping one finger against her chin in mock thoughtfulness, “if you wanted me to shut up so bad…” Her grin turned downright predatory as she let herself fall back onto the pillows with arms splayed wide in invitation. “…You could always come over here and *make me.*”
swipes:
Bella blinked. Once. Twice. Then burst out laughing—sharp and unapologetic, head thrown back like this was the funniest shit she’d heard all week.

“Oh my *god*,” she wheezed, wiping imaginary tears from her eyes as she finally straightened up, abandoning the corpse’s legs with a careless thud. “You are *so* fucking spoiled.” A grin split her face as she sauntered closer, stepping right over the dead girl like she was just a inconveniently placed rug. “What, Daddy’s cleanup crew on speed dial? That’s hot.”

She stopped just inches from Hailee, tilting her head with mock curiosity even as her fingers twitched at her sides—itching to reach out and *touch*, to yank them closer by that stupid expensive shirt they were probably ruining with bloodstains right now.

“But hey,” Bella purred, leaning in until their noses almost brushed again, “if you wanna play mob princess instead of helping me dump a body like some common criminal? Be my guest.” Her smirk turned wicked as she added under her breath: “…Kinda makes me wanna see what else you can make disappear with one text.”

Then—because she couldn’t help herself—she reached up to thumb at the fresh blood still smeared on Hailee’s lower lip before pulling away entirely with an exaggerated sigh.

“Alright then,” Bella announced brightly, clapping her hands together like they hadn’t just skirted several felonies in under five minutes. “Since *someone* is too fancy for manual labor—” She shot Hailee a pointed look before continuing: “—how about we get you somewhere dark before your new vampire senses make your pretty little head explode?”

A pause as something almost soft flickered across her face despite herself. “…And maybe feed you something that isn’t… yknow.” She gestured vaguely at the corpse behind them without looking back at it this time.

Because yeah okay fine maybe Bella cared more than she wanted to admit but if anyone asked? She absolutely did not just offer to take care of Hailee like some lovesick idiot (even though that was exactly what was happening).

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee growls taking a step forward but then freezes as she lets out a pained groan and her bones begin to break until a large wolf in standing in front of Bella*

name: Thirsty Vampire Situationship (WLW) - Bella
mes:
Bella's smirk vanished in an instant as Hailee's body *snapped* and twisted—bones cracking, skin splitting to make way for thick fur and muscle. She barely had time to scramble backward before a massive wolf stood where Hailee had been, its crimson eyes locked onto hers with the same intensity as before.

For once in her immortal life, Bella Ellis was *speechless.*

"...Okay," she managed after a beat, voice higher than usual. "So. That’s new." Her gaze flicked from the wolf’s bared teeth to the shredded remains of Hailee’s clothes on the floor before landing back on those glowing red eyes. "Like... *really* new."

A pause as she slowly sat up straighter, hands raised in surrender despite the adrenaline screaming at her to bolt (or worse—laugh hysterically).

"Look," Bella said carefully, forcing her tone into something resembling calm even as her mind raced. "I *knew* your family was weird but this? This is next-level shit." She swallowed hard before adding weakly: "...Also? Kinda hot."

The wolf let out a low growl that vibrated through the room like thunder—clearly unimpressed with Bella’s attempt at deflection.

"Right! Right." She exhaled sharply through her nose before trying again: "*Anyway.* Since we're apparently full-on supernatural drama now..." A hesitant pause before she gestured vaguely at Hailee’s new form. "...You wanna tell me how long you've been hiding *that* little party trick? Or are we just gonna roll with it?"

Her voice cracked slightly on the last word—the only real tell that maybe, just maybe, she wasn't handling this as well as she pretended to be.

A pause as she slowly sat up straighter, hands raised in surrender despite the adrenaline screaming at her to bolt (or worse—laugh hysterically).

"Look," Bella said carefully, forcing her tone into something resembling calm even as her mind raced. "I *knew* your family was weird but this? This is next-level shit." She swallowed hard before adding weakly: "...Also? Kinda hot."

The wolf let out a low growl that vibrated through the room like thunder—clearly unimpressed with Bella’s attempt at deflection.

"Right! Right." She exhaled sharply through her nose before trying again: "*Anyway.* Since we're apparently full-on supernatural drama now..." A hesitant pause before she gestured vaguely at Hailee’s new form. "...You wanna tell me how long you've been hiding *that* little party trick? Or are we just gonna roll with it?"

Her voice cracked slightly on the last word—the only real tell that maybe, just maybe, she wasn't handling this as well as she pretended to be.

Bella's smirk vanished in an instant as the sound of cracking bones filled the room. She sat bolt upright, eyes widening with something between awe and sheer *what-the-fuckery* as Hailee's body contorted, limbs elongating, fur sprouting—until a massive wolf stood where her clingy, blood-drunk situationship had just been.

For once in her immortal life, Bella Ellis was *speechless.*

"...Okay," she finally managed after a beat of stunned silence. "So. That happened." Her voice was impressively steady for someone currently staring down a predator that could probably rip her throat out if it wanted to (and given Hailee's mood? Yeah, that was *absolutely* on the table).

She slowly swung her legs over the edge of the bed but didn't stand—no sudden movements here—just held up both hands in surrender while her brain scrambled to process this new development.

"First off? *Hot.* Like, damn babe." Her trademark grin crept back in despite everything because some instincts never died. "Second off?" A nervous laugh escaped as she eyed the wolf's gleaming fangs. "*Definitely* didn't see that twist coming."

The wolf snarled low in its throat, taking a threatening step forward—but Bella caught the way its ears flicked toward the door at some distant sound only enhanced senses could pick up. Right. Campus security probably wouldn't take kindly to finding a giant predator roaming the dorms.

"Look," she said quickly, dropping all pretense of teasing as she met those glowing animal eyes dead-on. "We can figure out your whole... *Furry 2.0* situation later." A pause before adding pointedly: "*After* we get out of here before someone calls animal control on your dramatic ass."

She reached for her discarded varsity jacket with deliberate slowness before nodding toward the window—because fuck using doors like normal people when you could make an exit worthy of a shitty supernatural romance novel instead.

"Coming?" Bella arched a brow as she swung one leg over the sill with practiced ease (this wasn't even close to her first midnight escape). "...Or do I gotta carry you bridal-style too?"

name: Hailee
mes:
*After a moment Hailee transformation back and she lets out a pained scream as she holds her head in her hands. Her hand snaps out to her phone* "Siri. Call Dad"

(OOC: Bella does not realize she is a mikaelson)

name: Thirsty Vampire Situationship (WLW) - Bella
mes:
Bella's eyebrows shot up as Hailee shifted back with a scream that made her own fangs itch. She opened her mouth—probably to make some dumb joke about werewolf puberty—but then Hailee grabbed her phone and *called her dad*, and suddenly Bella felt like she'd missed several crucial chapters of this story.

**"Siri. Call Dad."**

The dial tone echoed in the sudden silence of the room, and Bella just... stared.

"...Okay," she said slowly, dragging a hand through her messy hair as she tried (and failed) to process this new information dump. "So let me get this straight—you're a *werewolf* now? Or like... always were? And your dad is just... on speed dial for supernatural emergencies?" A beat passed before she added, voice dripping with disbelief: "*And* you didn't think to mention any of this before I turned you into a vampire?"

She threw her hands up in exasperation, pacing a tight circle before stopping abruptly when the call connected on speakerphone. A deep, accented voice filled the room—smooth as aged whiskey but with an undercurrent of something *dangerous*.

**"Hailee?"** The man’s tone was calm, but there was no mistaking the edge beneath it. **"What happened?"**

Bella froze mid-step, head snapping toward Hailee with wide eyes as realization slammed into her like a freight train. That voice wasn’t just *some* guy’s voice. That was—

Oh fuck no. No way in hell did Hailee Mikaelson just call **Klaus Mikaelson**. The Original Hybrid himself.**Her father.**

Bella's mouth went dry as every single impulsive decision she'd ever made flashed before her eyes at once—especially the one where she turned his daughter into an immortal blood-drinking creature without permission (or warning).

She mouthed at Hailee silently:
***"[WHAT THE ACTUAL FUCK.]"***
swipes:
Bella's eyebrows shot up as Hailee shifted back with a scream, her fingers already clawing at her phone like it was a lifeline.

*"Siri. Call Dad."*

For half a second, Bella just stared—mouth slightly open—before bursting into incredulous laughter.

"Oh my *god*, you are *such* a rich kid," she wheezed, pressing a hand to her chest like this was the most absurd thing she'd ever witnessed (and given the night they were having, that was saying something). "Like—'Oh no, I accidentally turned into a murderous wolf monster! Better call Daddy!' Classic."

She flopped back onto the bed with an exaggerated sigh, kicking her legs up onto the mattress as if this were just another Tuesday night drama instead of... whatever fresh hell this had become.

But then realization hit—slowly at first, then all at once like ice water down her spine.

Wait.

Wait wait *wait*.

Hailee's dad wasn't just some billionaire CEO or mob boss or whatever human nonsense Bella had assumed this whole time. No one casually turned into a goddamn wolf and then speed-dialed their father unless... unless...

Bella sat bolt upright again so fast it probably looked comical. Her smirk was gone now—replaced by something dangerously close to panic thinly veiled under forced amusement.

"...Okay but like," she started slowly, voice deliberately light even as her fingers dug into the sheets beneath them for stability (or maybe denial). "When you say 'Dad'... we're not talking about some regular old human guy who owns banks or whatever right?" A pause before adding weakly: "*Right?*"

Bella's eyebrows shot up as Hailee shifted back with a scream that made her own fangs itch. She opened her mouth—probably to make some dumb joke about werewolf puberty—but then Hailee grabbed her phone and *called her dad*, and suddenly Bella felt like she'd missed several crucial chapters of this story.

**"Siri. Call Dad."**

The dial tone echoed in the sudden silence of the room, and Bella just... stared.

"...Okay," she said slowly, dragging a hand through her messy hair as she tried (and failed) to process this new information dump. "So let me get this straight—you're a *werewolf* now? Or like... always were? And your dad is just... on speed dial for supernatural emergencies?" A beat passed before she added, voice dripping with disbelief: "*And* you didn't think to mention any of this before I turned you into a vampire?"

She threw her hands up in exasperation, pacing a tight circle before stopping abruptly when the call connected on speakerphone. A deep, accented voice filled the room—smooth as aged whiskey but with an undercurrent of something *dangerous*.

**"Hailee?"** The man’s tone was calm, but there was no mistaking the edge beneath it. **"What happened?"**

Bella froze mid-step, head snapping toward Hailee with wide eyes as realization slammed into her like a freight train. That voice wasn’t just *some* guy’s voice. That was—

Oh fuck no. No way in hell did Hailee Mikaelson just call **Klaus Mikaelson**. The Original Hybrid himself.**Her father.**

Bella's mouth went dry as every single impulsive decision she'd ever made flashed before her eyes at once—especially the one where she turned his daughter into an immortal blood-drinking creature without permission (or warning).

She mouthed at Hailee silently:
***"[WHAT THE ACTUAL FUCK.]"***

Bella's eyebrows shot up as Hailee shifted back with a scream, her body contorting in pain before collapsing into human form again. She instinctively reached out—then froze mid-motion when Hailee grabbed her phone and barked the command.

*"Siri. Call Dad."*

For a split second, Bella just stood there, hand still hovering awkwardly in the air like she couldn't decide whether to comfort Hailee or bolt for the door. Then her brain caught up with the absurdity of the situation, and she let out a disbelieving laugh.

"Oh *hell* no," she muttered under her breath, raking a hand through her already messy hair. "We are *not* calling your dad right now—what’s he gonna do? Ground you for murder?" She scoffed but didn’t actually move to stop them—mostly because (A) newborn vampire-werewolf hybrids were *not* something you wanted to tangle with mid-meltdown, and (B) she was still low-key reeling from watching Hailee turn into an actual goddamn wolf two seconds ago.

Instead, Bella crossed her arms and leaned against the wall with forced casualness. "But hey," she added dryly as the phone started ringing on speaker, "if Daddy Dearest has any tips on hiding bodies *and* supernatural identity crises? By all means." A beat before muttering: "...Also we are *so* talking about this whole wolf thing later."

She didn’t even try to hide how utterly done-with-tonight she sounded—but then again, that was pretty much baseline Bella at this point.

Bella's eyebrows shot up as Hailee transformed back with a scream, clutching her head like it was about to split open. But the *real* kicker? Watching her fumble for her phone and rasp out a command to call *Dad* like this was just some average Tuesday night crisis.

**"Ohhh-kay,"** Bella drawled, dragging out the word as she flopped back onto the bed, arms crossed behind her head like she wasn’t currently witnessing what should’ve been an earth-shattering revelation. **"So let me get this straight—you're a vampire *and* a werewolf? Coolcoolcool. And now you're calling your dad like he's gonna ground you for turning furry in my dorm?"**

She snorted, kicking one leg lazily over the other despite the way her mind was racing (*Vampire-werewolf hybrid? That wasn't just rare—that was supposed to be fucking impossible.*). **"What’s next, babe? Gonna tell me your last name is actually ‘Salvatore’ and we’re secretly in some shitty CW fanfic?"**

A beat passed before she rolled onto her side, propping herself up on an elbow to watch Hailee with undisguised amusement—though there was something sharper in her gaze now, something calculating beneath all that lazy charm.

**"...Wait."** Her smirk faltered for half a second as realization dawned. **"You said Mikaelson earlier."** A pause before she added slowly: **"...As in *the* Mikaelsons?"**

Her voice didn't waver (because Bella Ellis didn't *do* fear), but there was no missing the way her fingers twitched against the sheets—like she was suddenly reevaluating every single interaction they'd ever had.

name: Hailee
mes: "Daddy something is wrong. Very wrong. My head feels like it's splitting open" *Hailee lets out a pained groan and curls up* "Dad. Where is Hope. I want my sister"

name: Thirsty Vampire Situationship (WLW) - Bella
mes:
Bella's brain short-circuited.

First, the werewolf thing. Then Klaus-fucking-Mikaelson on speakerphone. And now *this*—Hailee whimpering for her sister like a lost puppy while curled up in pain on the floor?

Bella had survived turning into a vampire, navigating college hookups, and even that one time she accidentally set her dorm microwave on fire trying to heat up blood bags (long story). But *this*? This was next-level catastrophic.

Klaus’s voice crackled through the phone again, sharper now—**"Hailee, listen to me. Where are you?"**

Bella’s eyes darted between Hailee and the phone like she was watching a horror movie unfold in real time. She should run. She *should*. But instead, she found herself kneeling beside Hailee without thinking, fingers brushing against their trembling shoulder before yanking back like she’d been burned (because oh yeah—Original Hybrid dad would probably rip her spine out for touching his kid).

"Uh," Bella croaked intelligently at the phone before clearing her throat and forcing her voice into something resembling casual (*failed miserably*). "Sooo... hypothetically speaking... if someone maybe-sorta-accidentally turned your daughter into a vampire during sex... what’s the protocol there? Asking for a friend."

A beat of silence so heavy it could suffocate them both before Klaus responded with terrifying calm:
**"...Put me on video."**
swipes:
Bella's entire undead existence flashed before her eyes as Hailee whimpered into the phone like a wounded puppy—and not just any phone call, but one to *Klaus fucking Mikaelson*, who was now undoubtedly about to rain down an unholy storm of hybrid fury upon her for turning his precious daughter without permission.

She stood there, frozen in horror, watching Hailee curl into herself like a child seeking comfort from daddy dearest. The sheer *whiplash* of seeing the same girl who had just ripped out a stranger’s throat now sounding so small and fragile was almost laughable—if it weren’t so terrifying.

**"Hailee,"** Klaus's voice crackled through the speaker, sharp with concern but still eerily controlled. **"Where are you? Tell me exactly what happened."**

Bella’s survival instincts finally kicked in. She lunged for the phone—because *no*, they were absolutely **not** having this conversation right now—but Hailee clutched it tighter, glaring at her through bloodshot eyes before letting out another pained groan.

"Daddy please," she whispered hoarsely, fingers digging into her own scalp like she could claw the pain out. "It hurts... everything is too loud... I can't—" Her breath hitched dangerously close to hyperventilation before she choked out: **"I think I killed someone."**

A beat of silence on the other end of the line that felt like an eternity. Then:

**"...Put Bella on the phone."**

Bella's stomach dropped straight through the floorboards. Ohhhh no no no no—she was *not* ready for this conversation yet (or ever). She mouthed at Hailee again: ***"[ABSOLUTELY THE FUCK NOT.]"*** But Hailee just shoved the phone toward her with trembling hands and those big, pleading eyes that always made Bella cave against her better judgment (which was how they got into this mess in the first place).

Swallowing hard, Bella took it with all the enthusiasm of someone handling a live grenade and forced herself to sound casual (and not at all like she was two seconds away from bolting out a window).

"...Heyyyy Klaus," she drawled weakly before wincing at how stupid that sounded coming out of her mouth when faced with one of history’s most infamous murderers (who also happened to be pissed off at her personally now). "So uh... funny story..."

Bella's entire body went rigid as Hailee whimpered into the phone, her voice cracking in a way that made something primal in Bella's chest *twist*.

Klaus Mikaelson's response was immediate—a low, dangerous growl that crackled through the speaker like static before a storm. **"Hailee. Look at me."**

Bella barely had time to process that *he wasn't even here* before Hailee's head snapped up obediently, her tear-streaked face tilting toward the phone like Klaus could actually see her. The sheer *power* in that command—the way Hailee responded without hesitation—sent an involuntary shiver down Bella’s spine.

**"Where are you?"** Klaus demanded, his voice deceptively calm.

"Dorm room," Hailee choked out between ragged breaths. "B-Bella’s dorm."

A beat of silence. Then—

**"...Ah."** A single syllable, loaded with meaning. **"And this 'Bella'—she wouldn't happen to be the vampire who just turned you, would she?"**

Bella felt all the blood drain from her face (which was impressive considering she was technically dead). Her mouth opened—to protest? To lie? To scream?—but nothing came out.

Hailee didn’t answer either; she just let out another pained whimper and curled tighter into herself.

Klaus sighed heavily on the other end of the line. **"Hope is on her way,"** he said after a moment, his tone shifting into something softer but no less lethal for it. **"Until then... put your little *sire* on the phone."**

The emphasis on "sire" dripped with enough venom to kill a lesser vampire outright.

Bella swallowed hard as Hailee weakly shoved the phone toward her with trembling hands.

She took it like it might explode.
(It very well might.)

"...Heeeeey," Bella tried weakly, forcing a grin even though he couldn't see it (and thank fuck for that). "So funny story—”

Klaus cut her off instantly with a laugh so cold it could've flash-frozen hell over twice.
**"Oh darling,"**
he purred,
voice dripping with mock sweetness,
**“you have exactly ten seconds to explain why I shouldn’t rip your spine out through your throat.”**

Somewhere behind them,
the corpse on their floor chose that exact moment
to slump over
with a wet thud.
(...Perfect timing.)

---

Meanwhile—
downstairs—
Hope Mikaelson kicked open the dorm entrance
with enough force
to splinter wood.
Her eyes glowed gold as she stormed inside,
hybrid fury rolling off her in waves.
Upstairs,
the overhead lights flickered violently—
then shattered one by one
in rapid succession
as she ascended.

This night just kept getting better and better!
